summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that a transcript of a deposition taken on November 6, 2009, in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic and may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is the subject of the stipulation to be entered as evidence.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense file a joint stipulation agreeing to the authenticity of a 2009 deposition transcript for use as evidence at trial.

keyFacts: The document is a court stipulation from November 2021 in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330).
The parties stipulate that a transcript of a deposition taken on November 6, 2009, in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic.
The stipulated deposition transcript is marked for identification as '3506-001' and is to be received as 'Government Exhibit 1006' at trial, subject to standard objections.
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at the time included attorneys Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Damian Williams, is the signatory for the prosecution.
